<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:170" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 170</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47421.7" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> </sense><sense id="n47421.8" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">such</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the like</hi>: sin est probus (Cresphontes maritus meus), Cur talem invitam invitum cogis linquere? Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 24, 38</bibl> (Trag. v. 158 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">quoi in re tali jam subvenisti antidhac,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:8:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 8, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid tale putavi fore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum abest, ut et ipsi tale quicquam facturi fueritis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:31:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 31, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a quo tale quid dictum referretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod erit ejusmodi, nihil ut tale ullā in re publicā reperiatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:23:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 23, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnem legem esse laudabilem, quibusdam talibus argumentis docent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:5:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 5, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec taliaque vociferantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 2, 13</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil metuens tale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:12:67" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 12, 67</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47421.9" n="2" level="3"> Esp., in discourse, etc., referring to something that follows, <hi rend="ital">the following</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as follows</hi>, <hi rend="ital">such as this</hi>, etc.: talia commemorat lacrimans, exterrita somno: Eurydica, etc., Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:20:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 20, 40</bibl> (Ann. v. 37 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">talia fatur: Salve, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 79</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 559</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 372</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">talia tum placido Saturnius edidit ore: dicite, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:703" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 703</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id tale est: occidisti hominem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 10, 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:41" default="NO">9, 2, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae talia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 298</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tali modo liberatus est,</quote> <trans><tr>as follows</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,005:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Cim. 2, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47421.10" n="II" level="1"> In partic., pregn., like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">toio/sde</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">toiou=tos,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">of such an especial kind</hi> or <hi rend="ital">nature</hi> (both in a good and a bad sense), <hi rend="ital">so distinguished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">great</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excellent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">good</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beautiful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fine</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">so great</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extreme</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bad</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">such</hi> emphatically, = tantus: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi tu, talis vir, falsum autumas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 5, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos corrumpis talis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">talem, tali genere atque animo natum ex tantā familiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">istam times, ne illum talem praeripiat tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 81</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus rebus tantis, talibus gestis, quid fuit causae, cur, etc.?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:29:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 29, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae tuā sponte faceres in hominem tantum et talem, calamitosum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:66:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 66, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbes tantas atque tales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:38:92" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 38, 92</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 4, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid negotii geritur, in quo ille tot et tales viros defatigat?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 13, 42</bibl></cit>: judices tali dignitate praediti, id. Clu. <cb n="TAM" /> 53, 147; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro tali facinore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 6, 34 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 10, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tamen is ad id locorum talis vir consulatum petere non audebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 63:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 63, 6</bibl></cit>: tali tempore, <hi rend="ital">at so critical a time</hi>, Balb. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 15</bibl>, A, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:35:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 35, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:37:8" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 37, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:303 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 303 al.</bibl>—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">tālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in such wise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in such sort</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">qualiter ... taliter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:7:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 7, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 11, 40, § 124</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 9, 8, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
taliscumque: <entryFree id="n47422" type="hapax" key="ta_liscumque"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tālis-cumque</orth>, <itype>talecumque</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n47422.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of about such a nature</hi>, <hi rend="ital">about such</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nearly so</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quale fuit malum . . . taliacumque, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
taliter: <entryFree id="n47423" type="main" key="ta_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tālĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. talis <sense id="n47423.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
talitrum: <entryFree id="n47424" type="hapax" key="ta_litrum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tālitrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>perh. from talus</etym>, <sense id="n47424.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rap</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fillip with the finger</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput talitro vulnerare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:68" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 68 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
talla: <entryFree id="n47425" type="main" key="talla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">talla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n47425.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a peel</hi> or <hi rend="ital">coat of an onion</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 201, 2</bibl>; cf.: talla <foreign lang="greek">krommu/ou le/puron,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
talpa: <entryFree id="n47426" type="main" key="talpa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">talpa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<sense id="n47426.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">masc.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 183</bibl>) [root scalp-; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ska/loy;</foreign> cf. Lat.: <cit><quote lang="la">scalpo, scalprum],</quote> <trans><tr>a mole</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 25, 81</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 7, 6, § 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:191" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 69, 88, § 191</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:38" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 5, 12, § 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:16:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 16, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 12, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
talpinus: <entryFree id="n47427" type="hapax" key="talpi_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">talpīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>talpa</etym>, <sense id="n47427.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">like a mole</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mole-like</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animal,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 9, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
talpona: <entryFree id="n47428" type="main" key="talpo_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">talpōna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n47428.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of grape-vine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 3, 4, § 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
talthybius: <entryFree id="n47429" type="main" key="Talthy^bi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Talthybĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*talqu/bios,</foreign> <sense id="n47429.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a herald of Agamemnon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 1, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 3, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
talus: <entryFree id="n47430" type="main" key="ta_lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tālus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>from tax-lus; root tak-, tvak-; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ta/ssw,</foreign> whence taxus; cf. taxillus</etym>, <sense id="n47430.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the ankle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ankle-bone;</hi> of animals, <hi rend="ital">the pastern-bone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">knuckle-bone</hi> (syn. calx). </sense><sense id="n47430.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:343" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 343</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 7</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 8, 22; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:253" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 46, 106, § 253</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:808" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 808</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">talum expellere,</quote> <trans><tr>to dislocate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:75:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 75, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extorsisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 5:24:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 5, 24, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47430.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n47430.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The heel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">purpura ad talos demissa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:40:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 40, 111</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 29</bibl> and 99; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 9, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">talos a vertice pulcher ad imos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summaque vix talos contigit unda meos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nudus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:16" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 16</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: securus, cadat an recto stet fabula talo, <hi rend="ital">whether it stands or falls</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">whether it succeeds or fails</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 176</bibl>; cf.: tibi recto vivere talo Ars dedit, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to act well</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conduct one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self well</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:104" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 104</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47430.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A die</hi> (orig. made from the knuckle-bones of certain animals) <hi rend="ital">of an oblong shape</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rounded at the ends</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and marked only on the other four sides</hi> (cf. alea); <cit><quote lang="la">while the tesserae were cubes, and marked on all six sides. Four tali were used in playing, but only three tesserae: ad pilam se aut ad talos se aut ad tesseras conferunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:15:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 15, 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:16:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 16, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 75</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 1, 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:13:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 13, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 21, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:16:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 16, 54</bibl>; Aug. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:71" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 8, 45; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 4, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 3, 171</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 7, 17</bibl>; cf. Becker, Gallus, 3, p. 253 sq.</sense></entryFree>
talutatium: <entryFree id="n47431" type="main" key="talutatium"><orth extent="full" lang="la">talutatium</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>; mining t. t., <sense id="n47431.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the superficial indication of the presence of gold under the earth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ita inventum est in summo caespite, talutatium vocant, si et aurosa tellus subest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 4, 21, § 67</bibl></cit> (Sillig, talutium).</sense></entryFree>
tam: <entryFree id="n47432" type="main" key="tam"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tam</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>orig. <hi rend="ital">acc. fem.</hi> of the demonstrative root ta-; cf.: tum, tamen</etym>, correlative of quam, <sense id="n47432.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">so</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so much</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47432.1" n="I" level="1"> As comparative adverb, demonstrative with correlative quam, introducing comparative clauses of like intensity. </sense><sense id="n47432.2" n="A" level="2"> As adjunct of adjectives or participles the intensity of which is expressed by a comparative clause, tam ... quam = <hi rend="ital">as ... as;</hi> negatively, non (neque, nihil, etc.) tam ... quam = <hi rend="ital">not so ... as.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47432.3" n="1" level="3"> In comparison between two <hi rend="ital">adjj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam esse clemens tyrannus quam rex importunus potest,</quote> <trans><tr>a tyrant may be as mild as a king may be harsh</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:33:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 33, 50</bibl></cit> (B. and K. bracket rex): <cit><quote lang="la">non tam solido quam splendido nomine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:18:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 18, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam culpae hostium justus existimator quam gloriosus victor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:8:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adjuro, tam me tibi vera referre Quam veri majora fide,</quote> <trans><tr>things as true as they are beyond belief</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:659" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 659</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum vires quam repentinae tam breves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:7:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 6, 7, 2</bibl></cit>.—Negatively: <cit><quote lang="la">non enim tam praeclarum est scire Latine quam turpe nescire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:37:140" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 37, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut illa ... non tam mirabilia sunt, quam conjecta belle,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:31:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 31, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 36, 76</bibl>: nec tam Turpe fuit vinci <pb n="1836" /> <cb n="TAM" /> quam contendisse decorum est, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 5</bibl>. —Tam preceded by <hi rend="ital">comp. clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">maximeque eam pestilentiam insignem mors quam matura tam acerba M. Furi fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam magni nominis bellum est, tam difficilem existimaritis victoriam fore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:43:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 43, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">donec quam felices seditiones, tam honorati seditionum auctores essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 2, 4</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47432.4" n="2" level="3"> In a comparison between degrees of intensity, etc., of the same adjective. </sense><sense id="n47432.5" n="a" level="4"> As in relative clauses, the adjective repeated (so esp. in Plaut.; <cit><quote lang="la">not repeated in English): tam liquidus est quam liquida tempestas esse solet,</quote> <trans><tr>as serene as the weather is wont to be</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam placida'st aqua,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2, 165</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam frictum ego illum reddam quam frictum est cicer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 7</bibl></cit>.—Negatively: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo orator tam multa scripsit quam multa sunt nostra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:30:168" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 30, 168</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tametsi non tam multum in istis rebus intellego quam multa vidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:43:section=94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 43, § 94</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47432.6" n="b" level="4"> The adjective not repeated. </sense><sense id="n47432.7" n="(a)" level="5"> The terms of comparison being nouns or pronouns: <cit><quote lang="la">tam ego fui ante liber quam gnatus tuus ( = quam liber gnatus tuus est),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fieret corium tam maculosum quam est nutricis pallium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam mihi mea vita quam tua Tibi cara est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:6:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 3, 6, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ni illam mihi tam tranquillam facis quam mare est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam crebri ad terram decidebant quam pira,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam excoctam reddam atque atram quam carbo'st,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 3, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quom fervit maxume, tam placidum (eum) quam ovem reddo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam sum misericors quam vos, tam mitis quam qui lenissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:31:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 31, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam gratum mihi id erit quam quod gratissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla ingenia tam prona ad invidiam sunt quam eorum qui genus ac fortunam suam animis non aequant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est tam violentum quam magna vis aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:30:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 30, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(cum sit) tam aurum et argentum quam aes Corinthium ( = cum aurum et argentum tam sit Corinthium quam aes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(ira) tam inutilis animi minister est quam miles qui signum receptui neglegit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 1:9:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 1, 9, 2</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Negatively: neque opes nostrae tam sunt validae quam tuae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil esse tam detestabile tamque pestiferum quam voluptatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:12:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 12, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque tam condenso corpore nubes esse queunt quam sunt lapides, neque autem tam tenues quam nebulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 101</bibl></cit>.—Virtually negative: <cit><quote lang="la">quod enim tam infidum mare quam blanditiae principum? ( = nullum tam infidum mare, etc.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:66" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 66</bibl></cit>. — With <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> pregn. (very rare): istam dextram non tam in bellis et proeliis quam in promissis et fide firmiorem, i. e. <hi rend="ital">whose superior trustworthiness is not so much in wars</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 3, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vectigal ex agro eorum capimus, quod nobis non tam fructu jucundius est, quam ultione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:39:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 39, 13</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n47432.8" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">quam</hi> in <hi rend="ital">subst.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid mali hic Pisistratus non fecerit, tam gratum est quam si alium facere prohibuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 16, 2</bibl></cit>.—Negatively: <cit><quote lang="la">juris interpretatio, quae non tam mihi molesta sit propter laborem quam quod dicendi cogitationem auferat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:4:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 4, 12</bibl></cit>. — <cit><quote lang="la">Virtually negative: quid autem tam exiguum quam est munus hoc eorum qui consuluntur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:4:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 4, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47432.9" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">quam</hi> in <hi rend="ital">adverb.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupam facito tam crassam quam modioli postulant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 21, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si era mea sciat tam socordem esse quam sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tua est imago: tam consimili'st quam potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sororem tam similem quam lacte lacti est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 87</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47432.10" n="B" level="2"> Tam with <hi rend="ital">advv.</hi>: tam ... quam = <hi rend="ital">as</hi> (<hi rend="ital">so</hi>) ... <hi rend="ital">as;</hi> negatively = <hi rend="ital">not so ... as.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47432.11" n="1" level="3"> Comparing an <pos>adv.</pos> with another <pos>adv.</pos> or <hi rend="ital">adverb. clause</hi>: satin' istuc mihi exquisitum est ... ? <hi rend="ital">Ar.</hi> Tam satis quam numquam hoc invenies secus, <hi rend="ital">with as full certainty as that you will never find this otherwise</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 106</bibl>.—Virtually negative: <cit><quote lang="la">quis umquam obeundi negotii studio tam brevi tempore tot loca adire potuit, quam celeriter Cn. Pompejo duce tanti belli impetus navigavit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:12:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 12, 34</bibl></cit>. —After <hi rend="ital">quam</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam dictaturam quam pertinaciter ei deferebat populus, tam constanter repulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:89:5" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 89, 5</bibl></cit> (the repetition of the adverb is especially frequent in tam diu ... quam diu; v. tamdiu).—</sense><sense id="n47432.12" n="2" level="3"> The adverb understood after <hi rend="ital">quam</hi>: sed tu novisti<cb n="TAM" />  fidicinam? <hi rend="ital">Tr.</hi> Tam facile quam me (quam facile me novi), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:4:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam facile vinces quam pirum volpes comest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam hercle certe quam ego ted, ac tu me vides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam audacter (ibis intro) quam domum ad te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam facile quam tu arbitraris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:6:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 6, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam cito evertetur quam navis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:34:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 34, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil tam cito redditur quam a speculo imago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:4:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 4, 2</bibl></cit>. — <cit><quote lang="la">Negatively: (ira) quia non tam cito in alium quam vult erumpit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 1:19:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 1, 19, 4</bibl></cit>.—Virtually negative (very freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">quasi vero quidquam sit tam valde, quam nihil sapere, vulgare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:39:81" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 39, 81</bibl></cit>. — With <hi rend="ital">sup. adv.</hi>: quam potes tam verba confer maxime ad compendium = <hi rend="ital">as much as you can</hi> (hence the idiomatic expression: quam maxime = <hi rend="ital">as much as possible</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 184</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n47432.13" n="C" level="2"> With <hi rend="ital">verbs</hi>: tam ... quam = <hi rend="ital">as much ... as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as well ... as;</hi> negatively: non tam ... quam, <hi rend="ital">not so much ... as.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47432.14" n="1" level="3"> One verb compared with another: <cit><quote lang="la">nam quod edit tam duim quam perduim,</quote> <trans><tr>for what he can eat I would give as much as lose</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vellem tam domestica ferre possem quam ista contemnere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 20, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utinam tam non pigeat ista facere quam non displicebit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tyrus et ipsa tam movetur quam diluitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:26:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 6, 26, 5</bibl></cit>.—Negatively: <cit><quote lang="la">fit quoque enim interdum ut non tam concurrere nubes frontibus adversis possint quam de latere ire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 115</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47432.15" n="2" level="3"> The same verb repeated or understood after <hi rend="ital">quam;</hi> the compared terms being, </sense><sense id="n47432.16" n="(a)" level="5"> Nouns or pronouns: tam mihi quam illi libertatem hostilis eripuit manus; <cit><quote lang="la">tam ille apud nos servit quam ego hic apud te servio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam hic scit me habere (pecuniam) quam egomet (i. e. scio),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 3, 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam tu filium tuum, tam me pater me meus desiderat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam huic loqui licere oportet quam isti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:6:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 6, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam tibi istuc credo quam mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec tibi tam sunt defendenda quam moenia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 44, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam moveor quam tu, Luculle,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 46, 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tamque id ... tuendum conservandumque nobis est quam illud, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:4:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 4, 17</bibl></cit>: amurcam periti agricolae tam in doliis condunt quam oleum aut vinum (<hi rend="ital">as well as</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:61" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam naturā putarem vitam hominis sustentari quam vitis, quam arboris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:24:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 24, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicut pueris, qui tam parentibus amissis flebunt quam nucibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira. 1:12:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira. 1, 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meliorque tam sibi quam aliis faciendus (est),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 1:15:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 15, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam solstitium quam aequinoctium suos dies rettulit (i. e. solstitium tam rettulit dies quam rettulit aequinoctium),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:16:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Q. N. 3, 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam orationis tam ornatus quam perspicuitas aut in singulis verbis est aut in pluribus positus (i. e. ornatus tam positus est quam perspicuitas),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 15</bibl></cit>. — This construction passes into mere co - ordination: tam vera quam falsa cernimus, <hi rend="ital">as well ... as</hi>, almost = <hi rend="ital">both ... and</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 34, 111</bibl>: repentina res, quia quam causam nullam tam ne fidem quidem habebat ( = ut causam nullam, sic ne fidem quidem; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">sic),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:27:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 27, 10</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 31:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 31, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:41:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 41, 24</bibl> Dietsch; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:17:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 17, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4:13:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 4, 13, 4</bibl>. — <cit><quote lang="la">Negatively: non tam meāpte causā Laetor quam illius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est quod tam obtundat elevetque aegritudinem ... quam meditatio condicionis humanae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:16:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 16, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae compararat non tam suae delectationis causā quam ad invitationes adventusque nostrorum hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:34:section=83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 34, § 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus me facti paenituit non tam propter periculum meum quam propter vitia multa quae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā nullā in re tam utor quam in hac civili et publicā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 17, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque eos tam istius hominis perditi subita laetitia quam hominis amplissimi nova gratulatio movebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 8, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Iliensibus Rhoeteum addiderunt, non tam ob recentia ulla merita quam originum memoriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:39:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 39, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47432.17" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Object-inff.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qualis est istorum oratio qui omnia non tam esse quam videri volunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 14, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid enim tam pugnat, quam non modo miserum, sed omnino quidquam esse qui non sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:7:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 7, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtute ipsā non tam multi praediti esse quam videri volunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:26:98" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 26, 98</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47432.18" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Subject-inff.</hi> or <cb n="TAM" /> <hi rend="ital">dependent clauses</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego illud argentum tam paratum filio Scio esse, quam me hunc scipionem contui ( = tam scio, argentum paratum esse, quam scio me, etc.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Parmenonis tam scio esse hanc techinam quam me vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam teneor dono quam si dimittar onustus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Acrisium Tam violasse deum quam non agnosse nepotem Paenitet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:613" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 613</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam perdis operam cum illi irasceris, quam cum illum alteri precaris iratum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 2:30:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 2, 30, 2</bibl></cit>.—Negatively (so most freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est quod tam deceat quam in omni re gerendā servare constantiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:34:125" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 34, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eundum igitur est, nec tam ut belli quam ut fugae socii simus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 2</bibl></cit>, a, 3: <cit><quote lang="la">nec tam quaerendum est, dolor malumne sit, quam firmandus animus ad dolorem ferendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:12:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 12, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tam ut prosim causis elaborare soleo, quam ut ne quid obsim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:2:72:295" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 2, 72, 295</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ego te non tam vitandi laboris mei causā quam quia tuā id interesse arbitrarer, hortatus essem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auxilia convenerant non tam Vejentium gratiā concitata, quam quod in spem ventum erat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:44:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 44, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Boji defecerunt, nec tam ob veteres in populum Romanum iras, quam quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:25:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 25, 2</bibl></cit>. — So with <hi rend="ital">causal clauses</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:7:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 7, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:3:30:119" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 3, 30, 119</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:64:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 64, 135</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 19, 3</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n47432.19" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">quam</hi> in <hi rend="ital">adverb.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam confido quam poti'st,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 3, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; and in Cicero's epistolary style, tam esse with predicative force (like ita esse, sic esse; <cit><quote lang="la">v. sic): atque ego haec tam esse quam audio non puto ( = tam male esse),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:3:section=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 3, § 9</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) Tam with a <hi rend="ital">neg.</hi> is sometimes followed by <hi rend="ital">sed</hi> with an independent clause, instead of a comp. clause: <cit><quote lang="la">quidam autem non tam id reprehendunt, si remissius agatur, sed tantum studium tamque multam operam ponendam in eo non arbitrantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit> Madv. ad loc.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (suaviloquentia) quidem non tam est in plerisque ... sed est ea laus eloquentiae certe maxima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:15:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 15, 58</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47432.20" n="D" level="2"> With <hi rend="ital">esse</hi> and <hi rend="ital">predic. noun</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam ea est quam poti'st nostra erilis concubina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:5:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 5, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equidem tam sum servos quam tu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam ego homo sum quam tu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 4, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam id nobis tam flagitium'st quam illa Non facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam es tu judex quam ego senator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam sum amicus rei publicae quam qui maxime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 2, 6</bibl></cit>.—With <pos>prep.</pos> and its case as predicate: <cit><quote lang="la">tam hoc quidem tibi in proclivi quam imber quando pluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui non defendit, nec obsistit, si potest, injuriae, tam est in vitio quam si parentes, etc., deserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:7:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 7, 23</bibl></cit>. — <cit><quote lang="la">Negatively: nihil est tam contra naturam quam turpitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:8:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 8, 35</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n47432.21" n="E" level="2"> With <hi rend="ital">quasi</hi> in place of <hi rend="ital">quam</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam a me pudica est quasi soror mea sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 51</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47432.22" n="F" level="1"> Quam ... tam with <hi rend="ital">compp.</hi> = quanto ... tanto or quo ... eo (ante-class. and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): quam magis aerumna urget, tam magis ad malefaciendum viget, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 15</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 303 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">quam magis adspecto, tam magis est nimbata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magis quam id reputo, tam magis uror quae meus filius turbavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 5, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam magis te in altum capessis, tam aestus te in portum refert,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo quaeque magis sunt aspera semina eorum, Tam magis in somnis eadem saevire necessust,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:999" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 999</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae quanto magis inter se perplexa coibant, Tam magis expressa ea quae mare ... efficerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:453" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 453</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam magis illa fremens et tristibus effera flammis, Quam magis effuso crudescunt sanguine pugnae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:787" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 787</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">quanto</hi> for <hi rend="ital">quam</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanto magis aetheris aestus cogebant terram, Tam magis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:484" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 484</bibl></cit>. —With <hi rend="ital">rel. adv.</hi> for <hi rend="ital">quam</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verum ubicumque magis denso sunt agmine nubes, tam magis hinc ... fremitus fit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 99</bibl></cit>. — Ellips. of <hi rend="ital">tam</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam magis specto. minus placet mihi hominis facies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47432.23" n="G" level="1"> Quam ... tam with <hi rend="ital">superll.</hi> = quanto ... tanto or quo ... eo (mostly anteclass.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">the class.: ut quisque maxime ... ita maxime): quam citissime conficies, tam maxime expediet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 64</bibl></cit> (65): <cit><quote lang="la">oleum quam diutissime in amurcā erit, tam deterrimum erit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 64</bibl></cit> (65): <cit><quote lang="la">quam acerbissima olea oleum facies, tam oleum optumum erit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 65</bibl></cit> (66): quam plurimum <pb n="1837" /> <cb n="TAM" /> erit, tam citissime canus fiet, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 157</bibl> (158) <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam ad probos propinquitate proxume te adjunxeris, tam optumum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam maxime huic vana haec suspicio erit, tam facillime patris pacem in leges conficiet suas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 2, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam vos facillime agitis, quam estis maxume Potentes, dites, fortunati, nobiles: tam maxime vos aequo animo aequa noscere Oportet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:4:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 3, 4, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam paucissimos reliqueris, tam optimi fiunt in alendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam quisque pessume fecit, tam maxume tutus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 31:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 31, 14</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n47432.24" n="H" level="1"> With <hi rend="ital">quam</hi> in immediate succession (to be distinguished from the <hi rend="ital">conj.</hi> tamquam, <hi rend="ital">as if</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">nam, si a mare abstinuissem, tam quam hoc uterer ( = tam illo uterer quam hoc),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 7, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam quam proserpens bestia (iste) est bilinguis et scelestus ( = tam bilinguis quam, etc.),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fers. 2, 4, 28</bibl></cit>: esne tu huic amicus? <hi rend="ital">To.</hi> Tam quam di omnes qui caelum colunt, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 4, 32</bibl>: vide, homo ut hominem noveris. <hi rend="ital">Sy.</hi> Tam quam me, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 68</bibl>: nostine? <hi rend="ital">Da.</hi> Tam quam te, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 15</bibl> (for tam diu, with or without quam, quam diu, etc., v. tamdiu).</sense><sense id="n47432.25" n="II" level="1"> With a <hi rend="ital">comp. clause</hi> understood. </sense><sense id="n47432.26" n="A" level="2"> With a <hi rend="ital">comp. clause</hi> to be supplied from a preceding sentence: <cit><quote lang="la">quae faciliora sunt philosophis ... quia tam graviter cadere non possunt (sc. quam alii),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:21:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 21, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur corporis curandi causā quaesita sit ars, animi autem medicina nec tam desiderata sit ... , nec tam culta (i. e. quam corporis medicina),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil umquam tam eleganter explicabunt (i. e. quam Plato),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 23, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non conturbat me expectatio tua, etsi nihil est eis, qui placere volunt, tam adversarium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed ea (plebs) nequaquam tam laeta Quinctium vidit (i. e. quam ejus amici),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:26:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 26, 12</bibl></cit>: nec minora consequi potuit (Maecenas); <cit><quote lang="la">sed non tam concupivit (sc. quam Agrippa),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:88:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 88, 2</bibl></cit>: nec tibi tam longis opus est ambagibus usquam, nec me tam multam hic operam consumere par est (i. e. quam consumere opus sit, si haec tractare velim), Lucr 6, 1079; so, tam gratia est (colloq.) = non accipio, sed tam gratia est quam esset si acciperem, <hi rend="ital">I thank you just as much; no</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thank you</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene vocas (ad prandium): tam gratia'st,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 3, 36</bibl></cit>: cenabis apud me. <hi rend="ital">Ep.</hi> Locata'st opera nunc quidem: <cit><quote lang="la">tam gratia'st,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 3, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: quin tu, quidquid opus'st, audacter imperas? <hi rend="ital">Ps.</hi> Tam gratia'st. Bene est tibi; <cit><quote lang="la">nolo tibi molestos esse nos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 2, 4, 23</bibl></cit> (in this formula, however, tam is explained by some as a shortened form for tamen; cf. Brix ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:386" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 386</bibl>, and v. IV. infra).—</sense><sense id="n47432.27" n="B" level="2"> With a general <hi rend="ital">comp. clause</hi> understood ( = sic, ita), <hi rend="ital">so</hi> (<hi rend="ital">so much</hi>) <hi rend="ital">as I do</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as you do</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as he did</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as I said before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as he is</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as you are</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n47432.28" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">adjj.</hi>: ut vos servem sedulo, quos tam grandi sim mercatus pecuniā, <hi rend="ital">have bought you at so high a price</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">as I have</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 8</bibl>: qui nummi exciderunt quod terram sic obtuere? quid vos maestos tam tristisque conspicor? (sc. <hi rend="ital">as I do</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as you are</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equidem miror, tam catam, tam doctam te et bene eductam, non scire stulte facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 3, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordine cum videas tam certo multa creari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:735" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 735</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deus ille fuit qui ista in tam tranquillo et tam clarā luce locavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorsum igitur tam multa de voluptate?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:12:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 12, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut mihi quidem, qui tam magno animo fuerit innocens damnatus esse videatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:42:100" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 42, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter ista tam magnifica verba tamque praeclara,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:23:77" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 23, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis est qui complet aures meas tantus et tam dulcis sonus?</quote> <trans><tr>as I hear</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:18:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 18, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tollite hanc: nullam tam pravae sententiae causam reperietis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 14, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: et tamen veremur ut hoc quod a tam multis perferatur natura patiatur? (<hi rend="ital">as it is</hi>, sc. <hi rend="ital">suffered</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:20:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 20, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut tam in praecipitem locum non debeat se sapiens committere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 21, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam necessario tempore, tam propinquis hostibus,</quote> <trans><tr>at so urgent a time as this</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 16, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supra triginta quinque milia hostium fuerant, ex quibus tam exigua pars pugnae superfuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:31:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 31, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam constantem defensionem Scipionis universus senatus comprobavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:7:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: ceterum ... ne tam praeclara lex ... oblitteraretur, id. <cb n="TAM" /> 2, 8, 1: <cit><quote lang="la">qui tam crudelem tyrannum occideret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne illo quidem tam misero tamque luctuoso tempore civitas nostra virtutis suae oblita est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:2:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam contraria est pestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 38, 57, § 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam parvo distat ibi tanta rerum naturae diversitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 11, 12, § 65</bibl></cit>; so, <hi rend="ital">tamne</hi> (cf. sicine): <cit><quote lang="la">tamne indignus videar?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 77</bibl></cit>.—And with <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nondum erat vestris tam gravissimis tamque multis judiciis concisus,</quote> <trans><tr>of so great weight</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 12, 5, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47432.29" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">advv.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alienus quom ejus incommodum tam aegre feras, quid me patrem par facere est?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est negotii quod tu tam subito domo abeas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde ego nunc tam subito huic argentum inveniam miser?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 3, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia (anima cum corpore) tam conjuncta atque leniter apta'st,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:559" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 559</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam mallem Cerberum metueres quam ista tam inconsiderata diceres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:6:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ista tam aperte et per versa et falsa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 18, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ex co quaereretur cur tam diu vellet esse in vitā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:5:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me pudet tam cito de sententiā esse dejectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:5:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">etsi hoc quidem est in vitio, dissolutionem naturae tam valde perhorrescere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:11:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 11, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an melius fuerit rationem non dari omnino, quam tam munifice et tam largiter,</quote> <trans><tr>as I have shown</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:27:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 27, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam quod jus civile tam vehementer amplexus es,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:1:55:274" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 1, 55, 274</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid tu, inquit, tam mane?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:9:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 9, 14</bibl></cit>: cur hunc tam temere (<hi rend="ital">as mentioned before</hi>) quisquam ab officio discessurum judicaret? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod suā victoriā tam insolenter gloriarentur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tam procul a finibus Macedoniae absint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:27:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 27, 6</bibl></cit>: non digna exempla quae tam breviter (<hi rend="ital">as I am going to do</hi>) nisi majoribus urgerer, referrentur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:7:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 7, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qualis esset quem tam diu tamque valde timuissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 11, 2</bibl></cit>; and with <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: tam maturrime comparavisse, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 184</bibl> P.—With <hi rend="ital">adverb. abl.</hi>: tam crepusculo fere ut amant, Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:77" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, 77</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tam vesperi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 15</bibl></cit>; v. III. B. 3. infra.—</sense><sense id="n47432.30" n="3" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">verbs</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut, ni meum gnatum tam amem, tua jam virgis latera lacerentur probe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid, cedo, te, obsecro, tam abhorret hilaritudo?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid tam properas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum te video nostrae familiae Tam ex animo factum velle ( = te tam velle nostrae familiae ex animo factum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">age, quaeso, ne tam obfirma te, Chreme,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 5, 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non pol temere'st quod tu tam times,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 5, 8</bibl></cit> (9), 9: <hi rend="ital">Sy.</hi> Eamus, namque hic properat in Cyprum. <hi rend="ital">Sa.</hi> Ne tam quidem, implying a corresponding gesture, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 2, 4, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam si explicavisset, non tam haesitaret,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>as he does</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:6:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 6, 18</bibl></cit>.—Sometimes with an <pos>adv.</pos> to be supplied: <cit><quote lang="la">quid ergo hanc, quaeso, tractas tam ( = tam male, or implying a corresponding gesture),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 4, 4, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graecos in eo reprehendit quod mare tam secuti sunt ( = tam vulgo. or tam temere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:3:section=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 3, § 9</bibl>; v. I. C. 2. <foreign lang="greek">d,</foreign> supra. — With <hi rend="ital">esse</hi> and <hi rend="ital">predic. noun</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam ego te tam esse matulam credidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:3:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 3, 72</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47432.31" n="4" level="3"> Preceded and strengthened by a demonstrative adjective (order: 1. demonstr., 2. tam, 3. adjective, 4. noun; or, 1. demonstr., 2. noun, 3. tam, 4. adjective). </sense><sense id="n47432.32" n="(a)" level="5"> After hic: <cit><quote lang="la">etiamne haec tam parva civitas, tam procul a manibus tuis remota, praedae tibi et quaestui fuit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:37:section=85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 37, § 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc hominem tam crudelem, tam sceleratum, tam nefarium nolunt judicare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 31</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">77: hunc tamen hominem tam audacem, tam nefarium, tam nocentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:14:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 14, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec mea oratio tam longa aut tam alte repetita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:13:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 13, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hoc tam exiguo vitae curriculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:11:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 11, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc tam taetram, tam horribilem tamque infestam rei publicae pestem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hac tam clarā re publicā natus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:19:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 19, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc rem publicam tam praeclare fundatam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:1:2:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 1, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec tam crebra Etruriae concilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in his tam parvis atque tam nullis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 2, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorsum haec tam putida tendant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hac tam prosperā pugnā nuntiatā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:11:16" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 11, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47432.33" n="(b)" level="5"> After ille: <cit><quote lang="la">ille homo tam locuples, tam honestus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:6:section=11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 6, § 11</bibl></cit>: illud argentum tam praeclarum ac tam <cb n="TAM" /> nobile, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 20</bibl>, § <cit><quote lang="la">44: illud tam grave bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 6</bibl></cit>, ext. 1: <cit><quote lang="la">ne illo quidem tam misero tamque luctuoso tempore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:2:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 2, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47432.34" n="(g)" level="5"> After iste: <cit><quote lang="la">tamenne ista tam absurda defendes?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:29:81" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 29, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ista admonitio tua tam accurata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae est ista tam infesta ira?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:30:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 30, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iste tam justus hostis, tam misericors victor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:10:34" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 10, 34</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n47432.35" n="(d)" level="5"> After id ipsum: <cit><quote lang="la">id ipsum tam mite ac tam moderatum imperium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:48:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 48, 9</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) After tot: <cit><quote lang="la">jacere necesse sit tot tam nobiles disciplinas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 48, 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tot tam valida oppida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:54:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 54, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tot tam opulenti tyranni regesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:24:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 24, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter tot tam effrenatarum gentium arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tot tam praeclaris imperatoribus uno bello absumptis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:28:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 28, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:27:13" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 27, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:13:17" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 13, 17</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tot ac tam validae eluctandae manus essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:26:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 26, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 12, 4</bibl>.— (<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) After hic talis: <cit><quote lang="la">da operam ut hunc talem, tam jucundum, tam excellentem virum videas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 21, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n47432.36" n="III" level="1"> As demonstr. <pos>adv.</pos> of intensity, correlative with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that</hi>, and its equivalents (qui, quin); so only with <hi rend="ital">adjj.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">advv.</hi> (not with verbs). </sense><sense id="n47432.37" n="A" level="2"> Without a negation ( = ita, adeo; <cit><quote lang="la">rare before the Aug. period): ni erit tam sincerum (tergum), ut quivis dicat ampullarius Optumum esse operi faciundo corium et sincerissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (maturitas) mihi tam jucunda est ut, quo propius ad mortem accedam, quasi terram videre videar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:19:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 19, 71</bibl></cit>. de qua tam variae sunt doctissimorum hominum sententiae, ut magno argumento esse debeat, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad eum pervenit tam opportuno tempore, ut simul Domitiani exercitus pulvis cerneretur, et primi antecursores Scipionis viderentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam parandus ad dimicandum animus, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tamen tam evidens numen rebus adfuit Romanis, ut putem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:51:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 51, 4</bibl></cit>: infimam plebem natura ipsa tam abjecto tamque imo loco collocavit ut nullā ratione erigi aut sublevari possit, Ps.-<bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Cons. 6, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam multa sunt, tamque misera quae perferunt ut nemo sit quin mori saepissime cupiat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem constat tam certā acie luminum usum esse ut a Lilybaeo portu Carthaginienses egredientes classes intueretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 8</bibl></cit>, ext. 14: <cit><quote lang="la">tam alacri animo suos ad id proelium cohortatus est ut diceret: Sic prandete, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 2</bibl></cit>, ext. 3: <cit><quote lang="la">in Theophrasto tam est loquendi nitor ille divinus ( = tam divinus est) ut ex eo nomen quoque traxisse videatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:83" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Scipio) bellum in Africam transtulit, tam lentus ut opinionem luxuriae segnitiaeque malignis daret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 1:11:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 1, 11, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:15:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Q. N. 1, 15, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">3, 21, 1: tam parvulis in faucibus ... ut non sit dubium, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 29, 43, § 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsum Macedonem tam graviter palma percussit ut paene concideret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:14:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 14, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47432.38" n="B" level="2"> With a negation, or in a question implying a negation. </sense><sense id="n47432.39" n="1" level="3"> Before <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> (very freq. in the class. period; cf. adeo, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, e.g. <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 39</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">numquam tam dices commode ut tergum meum Tuam in fidem committam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tam viva tamen, calidus queat ut fieri fons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:887" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 887</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis umquam praedo fuit tam nefarius, quis pirata tam barbarus ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:50:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 50, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non sum tam stultus, ut te usurā falsi gaudii frui velim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec, cum id faciebamus tam eramus amentes ut explorata nobis esset victoria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non essem tam inurbanus ac paene inhumanus uti in eo gravarer quod vos cupere sentirem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:2:90:365" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 2, 90, 365</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non puto tam expeditum negotium futurum ut non habeat aliquid morae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:31:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 31, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec vero eram tam indoctus ignarusque rerum ut frangerer animo propter, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:15:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 15, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis tam demens ut suā voluntate maereat?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:29:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 29, 71</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:20:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 20, 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 4, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non enim proferremus vino oppressos ... tam absurde, ut tum diceremus, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 17, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non se tam barbarum ut non sciret, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:44:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 44, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulli sunt tam feri et sui juris affectus ut non disciplinā perdomentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 2:12:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 2, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo tam divos habuit faventes, crastinum ut posset sibi polliceri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 619" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Thyest. 619</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47432.40" n="2" level="3"> With a negation (esp. nemo), followed by qui ( = ut is; class. and freq.); nec quisquam sit tam opulentus qui mihi obsistat in viā, <pb n="1838" /> <cb n="TAMD" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">generi lenonio Numquam deus ullus tam benignus fuit, qui fuerit propitius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an ille tam esset stultus qui mihi mille nummum crederet?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo inventus est tam amens, qui illud argentum tam praeclarum ac tam nobile eriperet, nemo tam audax qui posceret, nemo tam impudens qui postularet ut venderet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:20:section=44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 20, § 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo Agrigenti neque aetate tam affectā neque viribus tam infirmis fuit, qui non illā nocte surrexerit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 43</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">95: nemo est tam senex qui se annum non putet posse vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:7:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 7, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil tam absurde dici potest, quod non dicatur ab aliquo philosophorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:58:119" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 58, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla gens tam immanis umquam fuit in quā tam crudelis hostis patriae sit inventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:27:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 27, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae est anus tam delira quae timeat ista?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:21:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 21, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecquem tam amentem esse putas qui illud quo vescatur deum
