esse credat?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:16:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 16, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed neque tam docti tum erant, ad quorum judicium elaboraret, et sunt, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:3:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 3, 7</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:19:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 19, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:7:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 7, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:6:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 6, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 15, 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 17, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:14:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 14, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:20:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 20, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:5:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 5, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque tam remisso animo quisquam fuit qui eā nocte conquierit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in bello nihil tam leve est quod non magnae interdum rei momentum faciat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 18, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nemo tam humilis esset cui non aditus ad eum pateret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecquid esse tam saevum potest quod superet illum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 196" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 196</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47432.41" n="3" level="3"> With a negation, followed by <hi rend="ital">quin</hi> ( = ut is non; <cit><quote lang="la">class. and freq.): nec sacrum nec tam profanum quidquam est quin ibi ilico adsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil mihi tam parvi est quin me id pigeat perdere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 6, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec quisquam est tam ingenio duro, neque tam firmo pectore quin sibi faciat bene,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 5, 2, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam tam mane egredior, neque tam vesperi Domum revortor, quin te ... conspicer Fodere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil tam difficile'st quin quaerendo investigari possiet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nullus umquam dies tam magnā tempestate fuerit, quin ... solem homines viderint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:10:section=26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 10, § 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam tam male est Siculis quin aliquid facete et commode dicant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 43</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">95: nemo est tam afflictus quin possit navare aliquid et efficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nemo tam ferus fuerit, quin ejus causam lacrimarit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 6, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n47432.42" n="IV" level="1"> Tam, ante-class., sometimes = tamen: <cit><quote lang="la">antiqui tam etiam pro tamen usi sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=360" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 360</bibl></cit>: bene cum facimus, tam male cupimus ... ; quamquam estis nihili, tam ecastor simul vobis consului, Titin. ap. Fest. l. l.; so, <cit><quote lang="la">etsi illi aliter nos faciant quam aequom sit, tam pol noxiae nequid magis sit ... nostrum officium meminisse decet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 1, 44</bibl></cit> Fleck., Ritschl: <cit><quote lang="la">tam si nihil usus esset, jam non dicerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:4:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 4, 3, 32</bibl></cit> Ritschl; v. Prol. Trin. p. 14 ib.; Brix ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 3, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:in Rhein. Mus. 6:84" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> in Rhein. Mus. 6, 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:93" default="NO">6, 93</bibl>; but cf. contra, Corss. Beitr. p. 272 sqq.</sense><sense id="n47432.43" n="V" level="1"> In the dialect of Praeneste: tam modo, <hi rend="ital">just now</hi> ( = modo): ilico hic ante ostium; <cit><quote lang="la">Tam modo, inquit Praenestinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 1, 8</bibl></cit> Brix ad loc.; cf. Fest. s. v. tammodo, p. 359; Ritschl, opusc. 2, 372.</sense></entryFree>
tama: <entryFree id="n47433" type="hapax" key="ta^ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tăma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n47433.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of swelling of the feet and legs</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tama dicitur, cum labore viae sanguis in crura descendit et tumorem facit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=360" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 360</bibl></cit> Müll.; Lucil. ap. Fest. l. l.</sense></entryFree>
tamarici: <entryFree id="n47434" type="main" key="Tamarici"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tamarici</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47434.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of</hi> Hispania Tarraconensis, <hi rend="ital">on the river Tamaris</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 20, 34, § 111</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:1:8" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 1, 8</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 2, 18, § 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tamarix: <entryFree id="n47435" type="main" key="ta^ma^rix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tămărix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n47435.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tamarisk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tamariskshrub</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:15:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 15, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:916" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 916</bibl>.—Called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">tămărīcē</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 21, 37, § 116</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:67" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 9, 41, § 67</bibl>; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">tămăriscus</orth>, Pail. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0594,001:8:1" default="NO"><author>Nov.</author> 8, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tamasos: <entryFree id="n47436" type="main" key="Ta^ma^so^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tămăsŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ta/masos,</foreign> <sense id="n47436.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ancient city of Cyprus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 31, 35, § 130</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tămăsēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Tamasus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:644" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 644</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tamdiu: <entryFree id="n47437" type="main" key="tamdi^u_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tam-dĭū</orth> (also separately, <orth extent="full" lang="la">tam diu</orth>; and less correctly, <orth extent="full" lang="la">tandiu</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n47437.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">so long</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for so long a time.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47437.1" n="I" level="1"> With <hi rend="ital">comp.-clause</hi> understood (cf. tam, II. B.): quid illaec nunc tam diu intus Remoratur? <hi rend="ital">as long</hi> <cb n="TAME" /> <hi rend="ital">as she does</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 4, 3, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud quidquam est quod cupiam tam diu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 1, 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid tam intus fuisse te dicam diu?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid illic tam diu restitisti?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 2, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">credo ego miseram fuisse Penelopam quae tam diu viro suo caruit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed quid haec hic autem tam diu ante aedes stetit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ludo qui fuisti tam diu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 3, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi te oblectasti tam diu?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae tam permansit diu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abs te tam diu nihil litterarum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te abfuisse tam diu a nobis dolui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: ducenti ferme et decem anni colliguntur: tam diu Germania vincitur. <hi rend="ital">for so long a time as this has Germany been defeated</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 37</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n47437.2" n="II" level="1"> As antecedent of a temporal clause, introduced by quam diu (diu repeated, cf. tam, I. B. 2.), quam, dum, quoad: tam diu ... quam diu, etc., <hi rend="ital">as long as.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47437.3" n="A" level="2"> By <hi rend="ital">quam diu</hi> (both clauses take the same tense; and if in past time, the <hi rend="ital">perf. indic.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">ego tam diu requiesco quam diu aut ad te scribo aut tuas litteras lego,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio tam diu potens est, quam diu deducta est ab affectibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 1:7:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 1, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Verres) tam diu in imperio suo classem vidit quam diu convivium ejus praetervecta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:33:section=86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 33, § 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Bibulus) se oppido munitissimo tam diu tenuit quam diu in provinciā Parthi fuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 19, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum (oratorum) quam diu mansit imitatio, tam diu genus illud dicendi vixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:2:23:94" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 2, 23, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur ea (signa) quam diu alium praetorem de te in judicium iturum putasti, tam diu domi fuerunt?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:19:section=51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 19, § 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignominia illa tam diu in illo homine fuit, quam diu iste in provinciā mansit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 27</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">67: manebit ergo amicitia tam diu, quam diu sequetur utilitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:24:78" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 24, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui urcus, cum recipit salem ... tam diu jam torretur, quam diu strepitum edit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:21:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 21, 2</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam diu discendum est, quam diu nescias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 76:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 76, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:31:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 31, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:9:section=25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 9, § 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47437.4" n="B" level="2"> By <hi rend="ital">quam</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hortensius vixit tam diu quam licuit in civitate bene beateque vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:1:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">M. Piso tenuit locum tam diu quam ferre potuit laborem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 67, 236</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47437.5" n="C" level="2"> By <hi rend="ital">dum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Claudius usus est hoc Cupidine tam diu dum forum dis immortalibus habuit ornatum,</quote> <trans><tr>only so long</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:3:section=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 3, § 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gracchus tam diu laudabitur dum memoria rerum Romanarum manebit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:12:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 12, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eas litteras cum lego, minus mihi turpis videor, sed tam diu dum lego,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Bajae nostrae) tam diu dum tu ades sunt oblitae sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 12, 1</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne tam diu quidem dominus erit, dum ex eis (servis) de patris morte quaeratur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:28:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 28, 78</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:12:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 12, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:33:96" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 33, 96</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47437.6" n="D" level="2"> By <hi rend="ital">quoad</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">tam diu autem velle debebis quoad te, quantum proficias, non poenitebit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47437.7" n="E" level="2"> By <hi rend="ital">donec</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">tam diu incenditur, donec, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:18:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 18, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam diu deferuntur atque incerta sunt, donec in solido resederunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:9:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 6, 9, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:3:15:5" default="NO">3, 15, 5</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n47437.8" n="F" level="1"> By <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">(Antiochus) didicit apud Philonem tam diu, ut constaret diutius didicisse neminem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 22, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae inductio ante tam diu subigenda est, ut rutrum mundum levemus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tame: <entryFree id="n47438" type="main" key="ta^me^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tămĕ</orth>, v. tam <sense id="n47438.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
tamen: <entryFree id="n47439" type="main" key="ta^men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tămen</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>perh. from tam and en, Corss. Ausspr. 1, 842; but cf. R<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Lat. Part. p. 27</bibl> sqq.</etym>, <sense id="n47439.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">notwithstanding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nevertheless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for all that</hi>, <hi rend="ital">however</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">still</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n47439.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n47439.2" n="A" level="2"> With a corresp. concessive or conditional particle (<hi rend="ital">quamquam</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quamvis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">etsi</hi>, <hi rend="ital">etiamsi</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tametsi</hi>, <hi rend="ital">licet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">si</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>, etc.; tamen stands at the beginning of the clause or after a prominent word; cf.: certe, nihilo minus). </sense><sense id="n47439.3" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">quamquam</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verumtamen, quamquam abest a culpā, suspitione tamen non caret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:20:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 20, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamquam me vester honos vigilare jubet, tamen, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:28:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 28, 77</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 9, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 12, 29</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47439.4" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">quamvis</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamvis sit magna (exspectatio), tamen eam vinces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:23:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 23, 37</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47439.5" n="3" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">etsi</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">etsi abest maturitas aetatis, jam tamen, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 18, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sed tamen etsi omnium causā, quos commendo, velle debeo, tamen, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 71</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47439.6" n="4" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">tametsi</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tametsi miserum est, tamen, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:20:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 20, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tametsi ille venerit, tamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:chapter=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 5</bibl></cit>, <cb n="TAME" /> 13; 17, 51; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 43</bibl>, and v. tametsi, II.—</sense><sense id="n47439.7" n="5" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">etiam si</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">etiamsi natura abripuit, virtus tamen, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:16:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 16, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:21:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 21, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:64:131" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 64, 131</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">etiam si ab hoste defendant, tamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 5, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47439.8" n="6" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">licet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">licet tibi significarim, ut ad me venires: tamen intellego, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 12, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47439.9" n="7" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equidem, ut verum esset ... tamen arbitrarer, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:6:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 6, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47439.10" n="8" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">si</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si taceo, interii tamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si Massilienses per delectos cives ... reguntur, inest tamen in eā conditione, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:27:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 27, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ipsa minus honestas, contumelia tamen, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:26:92" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 26, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si omnes deos hominesque celare possimus, nihil tamen, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:17:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 17, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 3, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si nullus erit pulvis, tamen excute nullum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 151</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:8:15" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 8, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:5:42" default="NO">7, 5, 42</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47439.11" n="9" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ea consecutus nondum eram ... tamen, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 7, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:10:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 10, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui (senatus auctoritati) cum Cato et Caninius intercessissent, tamen est perscripta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47439.12" n="B" level="2"> Without correl. particle: <cit><quote lang="la">retraham ad me illud argentum tamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: Divitiacus dixit, scire se illa esse vera; <cit><quote lang="la">sese tamen amore fraterno commoveri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 20</bibl></cit>: expellitur ex oppido Gergoviā; <cit><quote lang="la">non destitit tamen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equites conflixerunt, tamen ut nostri superiores fuerint,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propterea quod reliquis tamen fugae facultas daretur, Sequanis vero, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>at least</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 32</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">neque recordatur illi ipsi tam infelici imperatori patuisse tamen portus Africae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:43:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 43, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo, defendente nullo, tamen armatis adscendere esset difficile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:33" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 20:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 20, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:4:21" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 4, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:6:28" default="NO">4, 6, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">semper Ajax fortis, fortissimus tamen in furore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:23:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 23, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui plusque fore dicant in pluribus consilii quam in uno, et eandem tamen aequitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:35:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 35, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id ipsum tam mite ac tam moderatum imperium tamen, quia unius esset, deponere eum in animo habuisse quidam auctores sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:48:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 48, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et Philippus minime, quin rebellandum esset, dubius, quia tamen inmaturae ad id vires erant, ad moram, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:35:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 35, 2</bibl></cit> Weissenb. (dub.): haec e pectoribus altis et eruditis orta sunt; <cit><quote lang="la">illud tamen non minus admirabile, quod servilis animus cepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:3:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 3, 7</bibl></cit>.—Emphat., beginning a sentence: <cit><quote lang="la">tamen contemptus abs te, haec habui in memoriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tamen aliquid nullius est ... tanta copia quae enarrare tuas res gestas possit. Tamen adfirmo, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Marcell. 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:55:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 55, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47439.13" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n47439.14" n="A" level="2"> With <hi rend="ital">sed</hi>, in transitions, in resuming the thought after a parenthesis, or in limiting or correcting something already said, or some inference from it, <hi rend="ital">but yet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but nevertheless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but still</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hi non sunt permolesti: sed tamen insident et urgent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 18, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed tamen velim scire, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:30:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 30, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">difficile factu est, sed conabor tamen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 43, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse ad me non venisset ... sed tamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid arte fieri potuerit—non enim jam satis est consilio pugnare ... —sed tamen quicquid elaborari aut effici potuerit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non perfectum illud quidem, sed tolerabile tamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:26:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 26, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 4, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">17, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 9, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 5, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravi morbo est inplicitus. Sed animo tamen aegrum magis quam corpore, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:56:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 56, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:4:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 4, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:16:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 6, 16, 3</bibl>; cf. also verumtamen. — </sense><sense id="n47439.15" n="B" level="2"> Si tamen, <hi rend="ital">if at least</hi>, <hi rend="ital">if only</hi>, = si modo: <cit><quote lang="la">aliqua et mihi gratia ponto est: Si tamen in medio quondam concreta profundo Spuma fui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:537" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 537</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:14:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 14, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si tamen illi (amici) non gravantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 1, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:21:6" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 21, 6</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n47439.16" n="2" level="3"> Ellipt. (very rare): utilissimo quidem exemplo; <cit><quote lang="la">si tamen acta excellentissimorum virorum humiliter aestimare ... permittitur ( = ita tamen utilissimo, si, etc.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:7:14" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 7, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47439.17" n="C" level="2"> In an interrogation: <cit><quote lang="la">si quinque hominum milibus ad vim, facinus caedemque delectis locus quaeritur, tamenne patiemini vestro nomine contra vos firmari opes?</quote> <trans><tr>in spite of this</tr>, <tr>notwithstanding this</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:28:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 28, 77</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so. si ... tamenne?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 10, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 7, 16</bibl> (3, 6); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:19:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 19, 50</bibl>.—Without <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur nolint, etiam si tacerent, satis dicunt. Verum non tacent. Tamen his invitissimis te offers?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 6, 21</bibl></cit>: —Quare tamen per plures dies motus <pb n="1839" /> <cb n="TAMI" /> fuit? <hi rend="ital">yet why</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:31:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 6, 31, 1</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so even at the beginning of a letter: tamen a malitiā non discedis?</quote> <trans><tr>and yet</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 19, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47439.18" n="D" level="2"> Ac tamen, <hi rend="ital">and yet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and that although</hi>: admirabile est quantum inter omnis unus excellat; <cit><quote lang="la">ac tamen, cum esset Demosthenes, multi oratores fuerunt, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:2:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 2, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">8, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:54:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 54, 115</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantus iste est hominum error! Ac tamen facile patior, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:15:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 15, 29</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">atque is tamen aliquis Ligarius non fuit,</quote> <trans><tr>yet not even</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:7:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 7, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47439.19" n="E" level="2"> Neque ... nec tamen, <hi rend="ital">nor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the other hand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and yet not</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cyri vitam legunt, praeclaram illam quidem, sed neque tam nostris rebus aptam nec tamen Scauri laudibus anteponendam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:29:112" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 29, 112</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47439.20" n="F" level="1"> Ne tamen, <hi rend="ital">that by no means</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">veni igitur, quaeso, ne tamen semen urbanitatis unā cum re publicā intereat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:31:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 31, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47439.21" n="G" level="1"> With <hi rend="ital">rel. pron.</hi>: qui tamen, etc., <hi rend="ital">who however</hi>, <hi rend="ital">although he</hi> (<hi rend="ital">she</hi>, <hi rend="ital">it</hi>, <hi rend="ital">they</hi>, etc.): <cit><quote lang="la">L. Lucullus, qui tamen eis incommodis mederi fortasse potuisset, ... partem militum Glabrioni tradidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 9, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut possint eam vitam, quae tamen esset reddenda naturae, pro patriā potissimum reddere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:3:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perturbat me etiam illud interdum, quod tamen, cum te penitus recognovi, timere desino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:11:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 11, 23</bibl>: fuit mirificus in Crasso pudor, qui tamen non modo obesset ejus orationi, sed etiam prodesset, <hi rend="ital">and yet its effect was</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:26:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 26, 122</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si vetustum verbum sit, quod tamen consuetudo ferre possit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 43, 170</bibl></cit>.—Qui tamen sometimes introduces a paranthetical concession: <cit><quote lang="la">alter, qui tamen se continuerat, senserat tantum aliud atque homines exspectabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:53:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 53, 114</bibl></cit> (v. Fischer, Gram. p. 573, 5).— </sense><sense id="n47439.22" n="H" level="1"> Strengthened by <hi rend="ital">nihilominus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">etsi verum judicabant, tamen nihilominus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:28:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 28, 76</bibl></cit>: tamen nihilominus <foreign lang="greek">*ai)e\n a)risteu/ein,</foreign> etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 15, 2</bibl>.?*! For tam = tamen, v. tam, IV.</sense></entryFree>
tamenetsi: <entryFree id="n47440" type="main" key="ta^me^netsi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tămĕnetsi</orth>, v. tametsi.</entryFree>
tamesis: <entryFree id="n47441" type="main" key="Ta^me^sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tămĕsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47441.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in Britain</hi>, now the <hi rend="ital">Thames</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 18</bibl>.— Called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tămĕsa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tametsi: <entryFree id="n47442" type="main" key="ta^metsi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tămetsi</orth>, <sense id="n47442.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">conj.</hi> [contr. from tamen etsi, which is freq. written in full, tamenetsi, as <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:5:10 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 5, 10 sq.</bibl>; Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:42:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 42, 168</bibl>, or Ann. v. 512 Vahl.; Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 378, 6</bibl>, or ap. Trag. Rel. p. 68 Rib.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 135</bibl>], <hi rend="ital">notwithstanding that</hi>, <hi rend="ital">although</hi>, <hi rend="ital">though</hi> (class. and freq.). </sense><sense id="n47442.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n47442.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">indic.</hi> (so most freq.): <hi rend="ital">Ca.</hi> Da mihi igitur operam. <hi rend="ital">Co.</hi> Tametsi non novi, dabo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 2, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">age, loquere, quid vis, tametsi tibi succenseo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tametsi fur mihi es, molestus non ero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:10:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 4, 10, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam edepol fugiet, tametsi capital fecerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 1, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obtundis, tametsi intellego?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 2, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:3:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 2, 3, 81</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non mehercule haec quae loquor crederem, tametsi vulgo audieram, nisi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:25:section=62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 25, § 62</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 7, 3</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n47442.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">memini, tametsi nullus moneas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 1, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47442.4" n="II" level="1"> With <hi rend="ital">tamen</hi> (esp. freq. in class. prose, partic. in Sall.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 4, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tametsi causa postulat, tamen quia postulat, non flagitat, praeteribo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae tametsi Caesar intellegebat, tamen, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 43</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:20:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 20, 55</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">27, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:8:section=23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 8, § 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 5</bibl>, a, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:20" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:48:5" default="NO" valid="yes">48, 5</bibl>; Quint. prooem. § 11; 9, 3, 2 al. — </sense><sense id="n47442.5" n="III" level="1"> Without a correl. clause, <hi rend="ital">and yet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tametsi jam dudum ego erro, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:16:section=35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 16, § 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tametsi quae est ista laudatio?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 9</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">19: utinam tibi istam mentem di immortales duint! Tametsi video, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tametsi non mediocris haesitatio est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:40" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 40</bibl></cit>; cf.: tamen etsi hoc verum'st? <hi rend="ital">Si.</hi> Tamen, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 2, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tamfana: <entryFree id="n47443" type="main" key="Tamfana"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tamfana</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n47443.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a deity worshipped by the Marsi</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 51</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tamiacus: <entryFree id="n47444" type="greek" key="ta^mi^a^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tămĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">tamiako/s,</foreign> <sense id="n47444.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the imperial treasury</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fisc.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47444.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedia,</quote> <trans><tr>crown-lands</tr>, <tr>imperial domains</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 11, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundi tamiaci juris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47444.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">tămĭăcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an occupant of crown-lands</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 11, 68, 1</bibl>. <cb n="TAMQ" /></sense></entryFree>
taminare: <entryFree id="n47445" type="gloss" key="ta_mi^na_re"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tāmĭnāre</orth> violare: <sense id="n47445.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">hinc contaminare dictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=363" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 363</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
taminiauva: <entryFree id="n47446" type="main" key="taminia uva"><orth extent="full" lang="la">taminia uva</orth>, <sense id="n47446.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of wild grape</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 13, § 17</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=359" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 359</bibl> Müll.—<hi rend="ital">The vine on which it grew</hi> was called <orth extent="full" lang="la">tamnus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:373" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 373</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 15, 50, § 86</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tammodo: <entryFree id="n47447" type="main" key="tammo^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tammŏdo</orth> (or in two words, <orth extent="full" lang="la">tam mŏdo</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n47447.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Prænestine provincial form for</hi> modo, <hi rend="ital">just now</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a moment since</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 1, 8</bibl> Brix ad loc.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tammodo antiqui ponebant pro modo, ut Attius, tammodo inquit Praenestinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=359" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 359</bibl></cit> Müll.; v. Ritschl ad Plaut. l. l.</sense></entryFree>
tamnus: <entryFree id="n47448" type="main" key="tamnus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tamnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. taminia.</entryFree>
tamphilus: <entryFree id="n47449" type="main" key="Tamphi^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tamphĭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47449.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47449.1" n="1" level="3"> Cn. Baebius Tamphilus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 49 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 13, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47449.2" n="2" level="3"> Baebius Tamphilus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 6</bibl>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tamphĭlĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">belonging to Tamphilus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 13, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tamquam: <entryFree id="n47450" type="main" key="tamquam"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tam-quam</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">tanquam</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n47450.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">as much as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">just as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">like as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as if</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as it were</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so to speak</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n47450.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <hi rend="ital">Sa.</hi> Esne tu huic amicus? <hi rend="ital">To.</hi> Tamquam di omnes, qui caelum colunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 32</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Cu.</hi> Serva me. <hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> Tamquam me et genium meum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 5, 2, 29</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Ge.</hi> Nostin' ejus natum Phaedriam? <hi rend="ital">Da.</hi> Tamquam te, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod video tibi etiam novum accidisse tamquam mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenebrae ibi erant tamquam nox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 5, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Si.</hi> Quālibet perambula aedes oppido tamquam tuas. <hi rend="ital">Th.</hi> Tamquam? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 2, 122</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inspicere tamquam in speculum in vitas omnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repente te tamquam serpens e latibulis intulisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ficta omnia celeriter tamquam flosculi decidunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:12:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 12, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sensus in capite tamquam in arce mirifice conlocati sunt, nam oculi tamquam speculatores altissimum locum obtinent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:56:140" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 56, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic tamquam pilam rapiunt inter se rei publicae statum tyranni ab regibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:44:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 44, 68</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 24, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:23:83" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 23, 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:16:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 16, 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">commenti sunt, se de terrā tamquam hos ex arvis musculos exstitisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:15:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 15, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47450.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n47450.3" n="A" level="2"> With a corresp. <hi rend="ital">sic</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ita</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud eum ego sic Ephesi fui, quotienscumque fui, tamquam domi meae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:69:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 69, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neve te obrui tamquam fluctu, sic magnitudine negotii sinas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:1:section=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 1, § 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut, tamquam poetae boni solent, sic tu diligentissimus sis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 16</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">46: tamquam levia quaedam vina nihil valent in aquā, sic Stoicorum ista magis gustata quam potata delectant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:5:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic ex corporis totius naturā et figurā varios motus cieri tamquam in cantu sonos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 10, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic tamquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:18:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 18, 71</bibl></cit> Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si potis est, tamquam philosophorum habent disciplinae Vocabula, parasiti ita ut Gnathonici vocentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex vitā ita discedo, tamquam ex hospitio, non tamquam e domo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:23:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 23, 84</bibl></cit>; cf. also: tamquam, ita, in the foll.—</sense><sense id="n47450.4" n="B" level="2"> With <hi rend="ital">si</hi>, in a hypothetical comparison, <hi rend="ital">as if</hi>, <hi rend="ital">just as if</hi>, etc. (always with <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">tamquam si claudus sim, cum fusti est ambulandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curabitur, Tamquam si intus nemo natus in aedibus habitet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 2, 1, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tamquam si emeris me argento, liber servibo tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:9:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 9, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui tamquam si offusa rei publicae sempiterna nox esset, ita ruebant in tenebris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:32:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 32, 91</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 2, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui, tamquam si arma militis inspiciunda sunt, ita probet armatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:21:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 21, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut istum, tamquam si esset consul, salutarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:41:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 41, 106</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:64:131" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 64, 131</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita me audias, tamquam si mihi quiritanti intervenisses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 9, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tamquam si tua res agatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:16:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 16, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Plancum ... sic condemnit, tamquam si illi aqua et igni interdictum sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 6, 4, 10</bibl></cit>.—Without verb: <cit><quote lang="la">id cum dixerat, universi, tamquam si deo, libentes parebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:22:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 22, 6</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n47450.5" n="C" level="2"> Sometimes tamquam alone, without si, is joined immediately to a conditional clause of comparison, <hi rend="ital">as if</hi>, <hi rend="ital">just as if</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tamquam clausa sit Asia, sic nihil perfertur ad nos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tamquam ceteris non sit habitura quod largiatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">M. Atilium Captum in Africa commemorat, tamquam M. Atilius ad Africam offenderit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:43:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 43, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:23:12" default="NO" valid="yes">45, 23, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:34:5" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 34, 5</bibl>; 29, 22, 1: quod a quibusdam sic <cb n="TAND" /> accipi potest, tamquam haec sententia priori diversa sit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:3:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 3, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:1:12" default="NO">2, 1, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ita dicunt, tamquam inter duas leges quaeratur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 4, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:1:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 1, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tamquam regum arcanis interesset, omnia scit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 24, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tamquam de regno dimicaretur, ita concurrerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tamquam non idem ubique di immortales sint, sed, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceteri, tamquam ita necesse sit, sequuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tamquam nesciamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 63, 63, § 154</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 106</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n47450.6" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">For instance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for example</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam secunda ... tamquam tormentorum patientia, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 66:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 66, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:65:8" default="NO">65, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Contr. 1</bibl>, praef. § 23; <cit><quote lang="la">1, 8, 14: ut non aliquos progeneret, tamquam piros silvestres et prunos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:11:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 11, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 87" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 87</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tana: <entryFree id="n47451" type="main" key="Tana"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tana</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tanas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47451.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river of Numidia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between Lares and Capsa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 90 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
tanager: <entryFree id="n47452" type="main" key="Ta^na^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tănăger</orth>, <itype>gri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47452.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small river in Lucania</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Negro</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Tangro</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 151</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tanagra: <entryFree id="n47453" type="main" key="Ta_na_^gra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tānā^gra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ta/nagra,</foreign> <sense id="n47453.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Bœotia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Grimadha</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:43:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 43, 111</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 7, 12, § 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:51" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 51</bibl>. —Hence, </sense><sense id="n47453.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tānā^graeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Tanagra</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">meretrix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:43:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 43, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Choroebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:745" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 745</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n47453.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tānā^grĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Tanagra</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">galli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:9:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 9, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:2:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 2, 4</bibl> and 13.</sense></entryFree>
tanais: <entryFree id="n47454" type="main" key="Ta^na^is"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tănăis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ta/nai+s.</foreign> <sense id="n47454.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The river Tanais</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">the Don</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:1:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:2:1" default="NO">1, 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:2:6 al" default="NO">1, 2, 6 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 24, § 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 7, 7, § 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 29, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 15, 24</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">Tanaimque nivalem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:517" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 517</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 38</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n47454.1" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tănăītae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of the country near the Don</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 7, 7, § 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 3, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47454.2" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tă-năītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">she that lives by the Don</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">an Amazon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 399" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 399</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n47454.3" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A river in Numidia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 90:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 90, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47454.4" n="3" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tă-năītĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Don</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">potor Scythicae undae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 5, 479</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crusta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 96</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47454.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A proper name of a man</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:513" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 513</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 105</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tanaquil: <entryFree id="n47455" type="main" key="Ta^na^quil"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tănăquil</orth>, <itype>īlis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n47455.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the proud</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imperious wife of the elder Tarquin</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 27, 70, § 204</bibl>.—Hence, as an appellative, for <hi rend="ital">a domineering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ambitious woman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:566" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 566</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 23, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tandem: <entryFree id="n47456" type="main" key="tandem"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tandem</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>tam and the demonstr. termination dem; prop. just so far; hence, transf. to time, after so long, after a long time</etym>, implying the end of long delay or expectation, <sense id="n47456.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">at length</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at last</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the end</hi>, <hi rend="ital">finally</hi> (cf.: denique, postremo). </sense><sense id="n47456.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n47456.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n47456.3" n="1" level="3"> Alone: Juppiter tibi summe tandem male re gestā gratulor, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 116, 29</bibl> (Trag. v. 242 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">ne navigarem tandem hoc aetatis senex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec illic est pugnata pugna usque a mane ad vesperum ... Sed proelium id tandem diremit nox interventu suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tandem cognosti, qui siem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tandem reprime iracundiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 5, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod si animi vis in capite esse posset ... soleret tandem in eodem homine manere,</quote> <trans><tr>in the end</tr>, <tr>after all</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tandem vulneribus defessi pedem referre coeperunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tandem milites conscendere in naves jubet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 7</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">7, 67: tandem desine sequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:23:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 23, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 15, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 5, 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">finiat ut poenas tandem rogat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:735" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 735</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:7:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 7, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47456.4" n="2" level="3"> Strengthened, </sense><sense id="n47456.5" n="(a)" level="5"> By <hi rend="ital">jam</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam tandem aedes igitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 39</bibl></cit> Brix; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:37:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 37, 103</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam tandem Italiae fugientis prendimus oras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 61</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 890</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">12, 497 (cf.: jam denique,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 70</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47456.6" n="(b)" level="5"> By <hi rend="ital">aliquando</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquando tandem huc animum ut adjungas tuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:4:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 4, 61</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tandem aliquando L. Catilinam ... ex urbe ejecimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">tandem aliquando,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 7, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 30, 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:27:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 11, 27, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16, 9, 4</bibl>; v. aliquando.—</sense><sense id="n47456.7" n="(g)" level="5"> Pleon., with <hi rend="ital">denique</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tandem denique asinali verecundiā ductus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 153, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">tandem denique,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3</bibl></cit>, p. 138, 39; 10, p. 245, 16; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">recreatus denique tandem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 12, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47456.8" n="B" level="2"> In partic., in interrogative clauses, <hi rend="ital">pray</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pray now</hi>, <hi rend="ital">now</hi>, <hi rend="ital">then</hi>: quid tandem, <hi rend="ital">what in the world</hi>, etc. (very freq. in class. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">quid tandem admisi in me, ut loqui non audeam?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: quid tandem agebatis, <pb n="1840" /> <cb n="TANG" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:13:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 13, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae res tandem inciderat?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 11, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod genus tandem est istud ostentationis et gloriae?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Roab. Post. 14, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 1, 1</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quonam tandem modo?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:4:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 4, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:4:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 4, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:19:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 19, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(id) quo tandem animo tibi ferendum putas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc, per ipsos deos, quale tandem est?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:38:105" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 38, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanto tandem illum moerore afflictum esse putatis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorsum tandem? aut cur ista quaeris?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:1:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quousque tandem abutere, Catilina, patientiā nostrā?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae quousque tandem patiemini?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 20:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 20, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:17:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 17, 48</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">utrum tandem ... an,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 10, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scis Quo tandem pacto deceat, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ain' tandem ita esse ut dicis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 4, 19</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ain' tandem?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 145</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:7:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 7, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 2, 3, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:15:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 15, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 21, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">itane aiebat tandem?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 1, 66</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">itane tandem?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 2, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 5, 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 2, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 2, 42</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n47456.9" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, for denique, <hi rend="ital">finally</hi>, to mark the final clause of a series (very rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tanetum: <entryFree id="n47457" type="main" key="Tane_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tanētum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tannētum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n47457.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a village of Upper Italy</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Taneto</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:26" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:19" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 19</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tannētāni</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Tanē-</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Tanetum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 15, 20, § 116</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tanfana: <entryFree id="n47458" type="spur" key="Tanfana"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tanfana</orth>, a false read. for Tamfana.</entryFree>
tangibilis: <entryFree id="n47459" type="main" key="tangi^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tangĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tango</etym>, <sense id="n47459.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be touched</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tangible</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quae tangibilia sunt manu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 7, 11, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 12, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 61, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tango: <entryFree id="n47460" type="main" key="tango"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tango</orth>, <itype>tĕtĭgi, tactum, 3</itype> (old collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">tago</orth>, <itype>xi</itype>, 3: <sense id="n47460.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">tagit Pacuvius in Teucro: ut ego, si quisquam me tagit. Et tagam idem in Hermiona: aut non cernam, nisi tagam: sine dubio antiquā consuetudine usurpavit. Nam nunc ea sine praepositionibus non dicuntur, ut contigit, attigit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=356" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 356</bibl></cit> Müll.: PELLEX ARAM IVNONIS NE TANGITO, Lex Numae ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=222" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 222</bibl> ib.: sed o Petruelle, ne meum taxis librum, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 176, 18</bibl>, and 180, 8), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>root tag-; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">te-tag-w/n,</foreign> grasping; <foreign lang="greek">th=,</foreign> take; Lat. tago, tagax; Goth. tēkan, to touch; Engl. take; cf.: inter, contages</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to touch</hi> (syn. tracto). </sense><sense id="n47460.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n47460.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">tangere enim et tangi, nisi corpus, nulla potest res, Lucr 1, 304: tange utramvis digitulo minimo modo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genu terram tangere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:24:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 24, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgā Virginis os,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:308" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 308</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem cubito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 42</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47460.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n47460.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To touch</hi>, i. e., </sense><sense id="n47460.5" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To take</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">curry off: Sa.</hi> Tetigin' tui quidquam? <hi rend="ital">Aes.</hi> Si attigisses, ferres infortunium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de praedā meā teruncium nec attigit nec tacturus est quisquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 17, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia tangam nullum ab invito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:25:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 25, 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 20</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n47460.6" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To taste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to eat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to drink</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">salsa sunt, tangere ut non velis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa (corpora) Non cani tetigere lupi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:550" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 550</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saporem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:745" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 745</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupiens varià fastidia cenā Vincere tangentis male singula dente superbo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Superorum tangere mensas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 173</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tetigit calicem clanculum,</quote> <trans><tr>has emptied</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 2, 10</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n47460.7" n="2" level="3"> Of places. </sense><sense id="n47460.8" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To reach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arrive at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">come to</hi> a place (syn. pervenio): <cit><quote lang="la">Verres simul ac tetigit provinciam, statim, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:10:section=27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 10, § 27</bibl></cit>;
